intro: Actinorhytis calapparia, commonly known as the red-flowered rock daisy, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is a low-growing perennial shrub characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces showy, bright red composite flowers that bloom in spring and early summer. Its leaves are narrow, grass-like, and covered in a fine layer of white hairs. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils.
